vignette.name: The Preferences Toolbar
vignette.bodytext: The Modify Selected Item button displays a pop-up menu of commands for modifying a selected attribute's preference.
The Show/Hide Attribute Names button toggles the display of an additional column in the Inspector that displays the programmatic names for an object's attributes.

You can use the Modify Selected Item pull-down menu to perform several useful tasks when you are editing attributes. You can revert to previously set or to default values, set an attribute value to match a color scheme you've created, or revert to the original value of an attribute whose value you have frozen.

ul.li: Choosing Revert Value from the Modify Selected Item pull-down menu will return the selected attribute to its previous value.
Choosing Set to Default Value from the Modify Selected Item pull-down menu will set the selected attribute to its default value.
Choosing Set to Named Default Value from the Modify Selected Item pull-down menu will return the selected attribute to the default setting for the currently loaded color scheme.

Choosing Set to Frozen Value from the Modify Selected Item pull-down menu to return a selected attribute to the setting you used when you originally froze the attribute. This menu item will only be enabled if the attribute has a frozen value and the current value deviates from that frozen value.
Select an object or objects in the Preferences window.
Click in any column in an attribute's row in the Preferences window to select it.
Click on the Modify Selected Item in the Preferences toolbar and select an option from the pull-down menu. When you release the mouse button, the selected option will be applied to your object.
